awd_abstract_narration: Parametric computing deals with problems where the input is a function          of one or more parameters.  This research will analyze various questions        in parametric combinatorial optimization.  These questions can be               described as either search or construction problems.  Search problems           involve finding the parameter values for which certain conditions hold.         Construction problems deal with determining the set of all the optimum          solutions that are obtained when varying the parameters within a                prescribed range.                                                                                                                                               Three specific areas of research are:  Parametric optimum subgraph              problems on graphs of bounded treewidth; Efficient combinatorial                algorithms for Lagranian relaxation problems; Implementation of                 construction and search algorithms, especially for problems related to          minimum spanning trees.  A common theme is the notion of algorithm              simulation, a technique that originated in the field of minimum-ratio           optimization.  This work combines this idea with other algorithmic,             geometrical, and graph-theoretical tools.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
